intro: Nesaea striatiflora, commonly known as the striped bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in opposite pairs along the stem. Nesaea striatiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
